Issues.Title: Passing slots through in wrapper component
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/romantic-mahavira-1s4v6](https://codesandbox.io/s/romantic-mahavira-1s4v6)







### Steps to reproduce
See the content below "Wrapper"

### What is expected?
All three variants, deprecated and new syntax in either order, should produce the same result

### What is actually happening?
All produce different results. In the example the final 'new syntax' variant seems fine, but it doesn't work with Vuetify (not sure if this should be considered their issue ore Vue's)

---
Passing slots through to child components is, according to what you usually find on the net, done with this syntax:

```
<slot v-for="(_, name) in $slots" :name="name" :slot="name" />
<template v-for="(_, name) in $scopedSlots" :slot="name" slot-scope="slotData"><slot :name="name" v-bind="slotData" /></template>
```
Unfortunately this uses the slot and slot-scope attributes which are marked as deprecated.
As a current replacement, the following syntax seems to be the correct one:
```
<template v-for="(_, name) in $scopedSlots" v-slot:[name]="slotData">
  <slot :name="name" v-bind="slotData"/>
</template>
<template v-for="(_, name) in $slots" v-slot:[name]>
  <slot :name="name"/>
</template>
```
Unfortunately this does not give the same result as the old syntax. Depending on the order in which scoped and non-scoped slots are passed, either scoped slots are not passed at all or non-scoped slots are only passed in $scopedSlots, which Vuetify (and maybe other libraries?) ignores for slots that are not supposed to be scoped.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Passing slots through in wrapper component" (#11478)

Issues.Title: When building library SCSS variables aren't being translated to CSS ones.
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://vuejs.org/v2/cookbook/packaging-sfc-for-npm.html.](https://vuejs.org/v2/cookbook/packaging-sfc-for-npm.html.)







### Steps to reproduce
I just begin writing components library according to https://vuejs.org/v2/cookbook/packaging-sfc-for-npm.html.
When I finish writing and build I couldn't use library then I looked into js and css files. Unfortuantely, I see the SCSS variables in CSS file.

I have wrapper JS and imported components.
I use installing method of plugin.
Then exported.

I've src/components/component/component.vue and src/components/component.scss.
I imorted  SCSS file in the component like this:
<style lang="scss" scoped>
@import "./component.scss"
</style>

### What is expected?
Seeing SCSS variables as CSS variables.

### What is actually happening?
Seeing SCSS variables in CSS.

---
I think there is something small to do again. But what? I think answer should be simple and I am missing something in my opinion.
FYI: I add sass-loader, css-loader, svg-loader, node-sass .

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "When building library SCSS variables aren't being translated to CSS ones." (#11475)

Issues.Title: Vue.js is transferring click from one link <a> to another
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.11 ### Reproduction link [https://jsbin.com/buxojec/edit?html,js,output](https://jsbin.com/buxojec/edit?html,js,output) ### Steps to reproduce 1. create a Vue app with two links `` in the template 2. one link ("external link") with an href that's hidden by a state variable in the app 3. another link ("flip the state") that's shown by the opposite state that has a `v-on:click` handler that flips the state 4, click the "flip the state" link In case the repro link doesn't work, here's the code: ```html
external link flip the state
``` ```js vueApp = new Vue({ el: '#container', data: { happened: false, }, methods: { makeItHappen(event) { // event.preventDefault(); // uncommenting this fixes it this.happened = true; } } }); ``` ### What is expected? It's expected that the "external link" becomes visible, but no other action. ### What is actually happening? The link is becoming visible and then is being triggered to open it in a new page. --- Thanks for working on Vue! It's a very fun framework to use :D
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue.js is transferring click from one link <a> to another" (#11474)

Issues.Title: Vue state does not sync with kendo datasource
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[http://dojo.telerik.com/aGENIHuW](http://dojo.telerik.com/aGENIHuW)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Click 'Test'
2. Click 'Update'

### What is expected?
Replace first row with second row of grid.

### What is actually happening?
No change on screen.

---
If I firstly click 'Test' (just only a same value assignment to state) and then click 'Update', strangely it does not work so the grid has no change. I found the Vue state was updated but the datasource won't.
If I firstly click 'Update', it works!

The problem is why, after clicked 'Test', the kendo grid datasource became cached and out of sync with the Vue state? If I don’t click 'Test', they do sync always. Problem occur only on “same value assignment”. If “different value assignment”, no problem. e.g.

    test: function(e) { //same value assignment ('update' function will have problem after executed 'test')
        this.localDataSource = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(this.localDataSource));
    },
    test2: function(e) { //different value assignment ('update' function works fine after executed 'test2')
        let ds = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(this.localDataSource));
        ds[0]['ProductName'] = 'hello';
        this.localDataSource = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(ds));
    }

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue state does not sync with kendo datasource" (#11469)

Issues.Title: Compiled CSS is incorrect (SCSS in single file component, using calc() with custom property)
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/AngusMacrae/solar-system-explorer](https://github.com/AngusMacrae/solar-system-explorer)







### Steps to reproduce
In the "client" folder, run "npm install" to install dependencies, then "npm run serve". Navigate to http://localhost:8080/ in your browser. Inspect one of the .planet-system elements and find the .orbit div within it. Note that in the style browser, the following line is applied:

    top: calc(var(--diameter-vw) / 2 - var(--orbit-diameter) / 2);

This is accurate to the scoped SCSS in the .vue Single File Component source file.

Now either run "npm run build" and spin up a local webserver, or you can just navigate to https://solar-system-explorer.netlify.app/ which is where I have deployed the site. The site is deployed directly from the /client/dist folder in the GitHub repo, the contents of which were generated by running "npm run build".

Inspect the same .orbit element as before. But now, you'll find that the following line is different:

    top: calc(var(--diameter-vw) - var(--orbit-diameter));

This line is not correct.

### What is expected?
I expect the two lines to be the same. The latter should be the same as the former because they are compiled from the same source .vue file.

### What is actually happening?
The CSS rule that is applied in my deployed app is not correct, resulting in breaking the visual appearance of the app.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Compiled CSS is incorrect (SCSS in single file component, using calc() with custom property)" (#11466)

Issues.Title: Can't get componentInstance property of vnode when using the v-slot directive on a <template>.
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/Xie-Jay/slot-issue](https://github.com/Xie-Jay/slot-issue)







### Steps to reproduce
I show issue by console.

### What is expected?
All vnode can get componentInstance property.

### What is actually happening?
ComponentInstance property is undefined when using the v-slot directive, but others not.

```html
<slot-test>
  <component-test slot="default" name="slot1"></component-test>
</slot-test>
<slot-test>
  <template slot="default">
    <component-test name="slot2"></component-test>
  </template>
</slot-test>
<slot-test>
  <template v-slot:default>
    <component-test name="slot3"></component-test>
  </template>
</slot-test>
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64340763/84982701-d1eeec00-b169-11ea-921b-a3d0cb96184f.png)

---
When I use v-slot to replace slot, I get this diffrence which really confuse me.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Can't get componentInstance property of vnode when using the v-slot directive on a <template>." (#11464)

Issues.Title: Input value gets out-of-sync (using v-model or :value binding) when input is a dynamic component
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/flamboyant-kowalevski-2sxo0?file=/src/App.vue](https://codesandbox.io/s/flamboyant-kowalevski-2sxo0?file=/src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
Edit the values in the 3 inputs under the "dynamic inputs" header.

### What is expected?
The inputs should always be in sync with the value `syncTextA` 

### What is actually happening?
After an input is edited, it no longer stays in sync with `syncTextA` 

---
The inputs under the "normal inputs" header behave as expected, it seems this is only an issue with dynamic inputs defined like  `<component is="input" />`.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Input value gets out-of-sync (using v-model or :value binding) when input is a dynamic component" (#11457)

Issues.Title: Watching deep changes in Vuex causes: [Vue warn]: Error in nextTick: "RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded"
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/chrisvfritz/50wL7mdz/](https://jsfiddle.net/chrisvfritz/50wL7mdz/)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a deep watch of a store state (In my case, a array of objects) and set options `deep: true` (Error does not show when `deep: false`, however it is need for my application)
2. Make some sort of change to that state.
3. Error appears:
```
[Vue warn]: Error in nextTick: "RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded"
```
```
RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
    at Function.keys (<anonymous>)
    at _traverse (vue.runtime.esm.js?2b0e:2121)
    at _traverse (vue.runtime.esm.js?2b0e:2123)
    at _traverse (vue.runtime.esm.js?2b0e:2123)
    at _traverse (vue.runtime.esm.js?2b0e:2123)
    at _traverse (vue.runtime.esm.js?2b0e:2123)
    at _traverse (vue.runtime.esm.js?2b0e:2123)
    at _traverse (vue.runtime.esm.js?2b0e:2123)
    at _traverse (vue.runtime.esm.js?2b0e:2123)
    at _traverse (vue.runtime.esm.js?2b0e:2123)
```

### What is expected?
Error should not be appearing.

### What is actually happening?
Error is showing as well as the freezing of my entire Vue app.

---
This error was able to be fixed adding an addition conditional to a conditional in the _traverse method of vue.runtime.esm.js.
```
if ((!isA && !isObject(val)) || Object.isFrozen(val) || val instanceof VNode || val._isVue)
```
(val._isVue was added)

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Watching deep changes in Vuex causes: [Vue warn]: Error in nextTick: "RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded"" (#11452)

Issues.Title: Documentation points at a cdn link that contain different versions
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/](https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/)

### Steps to reproduce
Go to "getting started" docs , and copy one of the urls, they should match the stable version (2.6.11), however these are:

* https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/vue/dist/vue.js - version  v2.6.11
* https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/vue - version v3.0.0-beta.14 (must ignore cache)

Ref: https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/

### What is expected?
Expected both to have version 2.6.11

### What is actually happening?
The dist version (which should be the stable 2.6 version) is not downloaded, and instead we get 3.0 beta 14

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Documentation points at a cdn link that contain different versions" (#11451)

Issues.Title: refactor: remove unused UserAgent variables of env.js
Issues.Body:
<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

<!-- PULL REQUEST TEMPLATE -->
<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update
- [x] Refactor
- [ ] Build-related changes
- [ ] Other, please describe:

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [ ] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [ ] New/updated tests are included

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)


**Other information:**
UserAgent variables `isPhantomJS` and `isChrome` in `vue\src\core\util\env.js` was no longer used since:
- Replace `isPhantomJS` with`isChrome`: [2019-1-11: refactor: better solution for async edge case.](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/commit/3504d7f6d6c8f5bf156fa9242bf54f502c077520#diff-f2722526eac8096c360952e2ffa057f9)
- Replace `isChrome` with`isUsingMicroTask`: [2019-01-24: fix: async edge case fix should apply to more browsers](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/commit/ba0ebd4771ddb5c56c1261f82c842b57ca7163a6#diff-f2722526eac8096c360952e2ffa057f9).

But now, they still exist and will be bundled into the dist version, eg: `vue\dist\vue.min.js`. 

These userless code can be simplified, And reduce production version size slightly, So I made this PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: remove unused UserAgent variables of env.js" (#11450)

Issues.Title: Double escaping of ssrNode in style attribute values
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.11 ### Reproduction link [https://github.com/kamilic/vue/tree/style-attr-escaped](https://github.com/kamilic/vue/tree/style-attr-escaped) ### Steps to reproduce You can add this unit test at `./test/ssr/ssr-string.spec.js` in Vue project. ```javascript it('should not double escape style attribute values', done => { renderVmWithOptions({ template: `
` }, result => { expect(result).toContain(`
`) done() }) }); ``` or clone the library and checkout to `style-attr-escaped` branch and run. ```bash npm run test:ssr ``` result: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8327041/84263892-e708c100-ab52-11ea-933c-151b484fe275.png) ### What is expected? No double escaping of ssrNode in style attribute values ### What is actually happening? style attribute will be escaped. --- This issues may be related to #7224; https://github.com/vuejs/vue/pull/7224

Issues.Title: Fix: TypeError: Cannot read property ‘path’ of undefined on Google webcache pages
Issues.Body:
This fixes an issue where the current route (`this.$route`) is undefined.  I haven't seen it in development or production, but I noticed that when the page is being loaded from Google webcache pages, the current route is undefined and causes an infinite loop, thus preventing the page from loading properly.  I have a post with findings here:

https://forum.vuejs.org/t/typeerror-cannot-read-property-path-of-undefined/98458
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix: TypeError: Cannot read property ‘path’ of undefined on Google webcache pages" (#3246)

Issues.Title: Navigation bug in vue-router >= 3.3.0
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.3.4 (but it exists since 3.3.0)

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/sqal/vue-router-navigation-bug](https://github.com/sqal/vue-router-navigation-bug)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Clone my repository, run `npm i && npm run serve`
2. Click on the following links

- Go to /users
- Go to /users/1

3. Go back to the previous page. At this point, you can notice that navigation is broken, because instead of users page Vue still renders the user page and clicking back again doesn't work, it still renders the last visited route.

### What is expected?
vue-router should display correct route

### What is actually happening?
To understand why this bug occurs you need to look at [this line of code](https://github.com/sqal/vue-router-navigation-bug/blob/master/src/router/index.js#L16l).  Even though I've added some comments there I'll try and explain what this code does. I added noop beforeEach hook there because I want to prevent a resolution of the initial route meaning I don't want to show dashboard or login page before the authentication check is resolved. Only after the user is authenticated (or not) I am calling `resolveRoute` function and redirecting the user to the correct page. This worked great with vue-router <= 3.2.0, but something has changed in the newer version and I can't figure out how to fix it in my code or if it has to be fixed inside a vue-router. Anyway, I would appreciate any help you could provide. Thanks

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Navigation bug in vue-router >= 3.3.0" (#3245)

Issues.Title: Browser Back Button does not update route or trigger watch:'$route' change
Issues.Body:
Upgraded to 3.3.4

this.$router.push() works as expected, however when pressing the back button in the browser, the url changes in the browser but the vue app doesn't change at all, and no watchers or reactivity is triggered.

Downgraded to 3.2.0 and everything works correctly.
Using history mode.

Can't provide repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Browser Back Button does not update route or trigger watch:'$route' change" (#3244)

Issues.Title: Push current with empty query isn't work
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.3.2

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/dsartok/pen/abdBxoM?editors=1111](https://codepen.io/dsartok/pen/abdBxoM?editors=1111)







### Steps to reproduce
If push from
**'someLocation?someQuery'**
to
**'someLocation'**
via
**router.push({path: 'someLocation', query: {} })**
it takes old query and throw NavigationDuplicated error.

### What is expected?
That it will be replaced to current page with empty query

### What is actually happening?
It get previous query

---
P.S.
fixed this with
router.push({path: 'someLocation', query: { someStub: 'some' } })

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Push current with empty query isn't work" (#3238)

Issues.Title: vue-router duplicates router-view contents when using prerender-spa-plugin
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.2.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/RudolfVonKrugstein/vue-prerender-test](https://github.com/RudolfVonKrugstein/vue-prerender-test)







### Steps to reproduce
I am reporting this for vue-router, but I am not sure if it is really a problem with the vue-router component or some other tool in the toolchain I am using.

1. Check out the provided git repository, which has been created the following way
  * A new project has been created with `vue create pre-render-test` and setup with typescript and vue-router
  * Vuetify has been added using `vue add vuetify`
  * [prerender-spa-plugin](https://github.com/chrisvfritz/prerender-spa-plugin) has been added and configured (see [vue.config.js](https://github.com/RudolfVonKrugstein/vue-prerender-test/blob/master/vue.config.js))
2. Build for production using `yarn build`
3. Run a simple http server, for example like this:
    cd dist
    python3 -m http.server
4. go to localhost:8000/about

### What is expected?
The about page, just showing

```
This is an about page
```

### What is actually happening?
The about page is duplicated:

```
This is an about page
This is an about page
```

---
Looking at the DOM I can see, that not the whole app is duplicated but only the contents of `router-view`.
It also seems that some unrelated changes to the project (like adding a toolbar) makes the problem disappear, or re-appear.
Maybe it is some sort of race condition?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "vue-router duplicates router-view contents when using prerender-spa-plugin" (#3237)

Issues.Title: `onReady` triggers the onError callback with a redirection
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->


This is a regression introduced in 3.3.0:


Given this code:

```js
router.beforeEach((to, from, next) => {
  if (to.path === '/') next('/foo')
  else next()
})

router.onReady(() => {
console.log('good')
}, err => {
  console.log(err)
})
```

The initial navigation would trigger the second callback passed to onReady instead of the first one. This is because the Redirection Error is now visible instead of `undefined`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`onReady` triggers the onError callback with a redirection" (#3225)

Issues.Title: Navigation guard redirect causes errors when navigating programmatically
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.3.2

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/vue-router-zb7l4](https://codesandbox.io/s/vue-router-zb7l4)







### Steps to reproduce
Click on Navigate button. It will trigger navigation via `router.push` which will cause an error.

### What is expected?
User gets silently redirected to location that was passed to `next(...)` in navigation guard.

### What is actually happening?
Call to `router.push` throws an error, but the redirect still happens.

---
In my app, users that have not completed initial setup process after signup should be redirected to setup page. There is a navigation guard for this: if user has not completed setup, do a redirect. When user logs in, app redirects him to home page via `router.push()`. And when user has not finished setup process, this will cause an error.

This behavior seems to be introduced in 3.3.0 by this commit https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/commit/4c727f9

I don't know whether this is a bug or intentional behavior. If it's intentional, why was it introduced? For me it seems counter-intuitive that a simple redirect causes an error.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Navigation guard redirect causes errors when navigating programmatically" (#3224)

Issues.Title: Typscript compile error - logger.d.ts missing in NPM package
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.0

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/chrisvfritz/50wL7mdz/](https://jsfiddle.net/chrisvfritz/50wL7mdz/)







### Steps to reproduce
Create default typescript project:

vue create test

? Please pick a preset: Manually select features
? Check the features needed for your project: Babel, TS, Router, Vuex, Linter
? Use class-style component syntax? No
? Use Babel alongside TypeScript (required for modern mode, auto-detected polyfills, transpiling JSX)? Yes
? Use history mode for router? (Requires proper server setup for index fallback in production) No
? Pick a linter / formatter config: Prettier
? Pick additional lint features: Lint on save
? Where do you prefer placing config for Babel, ESLint, etc.? In dedicated config files

cd test
npm run serve


### What is expected?
Expects to compile without errors.

### What is actually happening?
ERROR in D:/test/node_modules/vuex/types/index.d.ts(7,26):
7:26 Cannot find module './logger' or its corresponding type declarations.
     5 |
     6 | import { mapState, mapMutations, mapGetters, mapActions, createNamespacedHelpers } from "./helpers";
  >  7 | import createLogger from "./logger";
       |                          ^
     8 |
     9 | export * from "./helpers";
    10 | export * from "./logger";
ERROR in D:/test/node_modules/vuex/types/index.d.ts(10,15):
10:15 Cannot find module './logger' or its corresponding type declarations.
     8 |
     9 | export * from "./helpers";
  > 10 | export * from "./logger";

---
logger.d.ts file is missing in types folder when installed via npm.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Typscript compile error - logger.d.ts missing in NPM package" (#1787)

Issues.Title: "types/logger.d.ts" file is missing from npm package
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/v3.5.0/package.json#L11-L16](https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/v3.5.0/package.json#L11-L16)

### Steps to reproduce
Run `tsc` or `vue-cli-service build` on repo with Vuex 3.5.0 installed.

### What is expected?
No errors.

### What is actually happening?
```
7:26 Cannot find module './logger' or its corresponding type declarations.
     5 |
     6 | import { mapState, mapMutations, mapGetters, mapActions, createNamespacedHelpers } from "./helpers";
  >  7 | import createLogger from "./logger";
       |                          ^
     8 |
     9 | export * from "./helpers";
    10 | export * from "./logger";
```

```
10:15 Cannot find module './logger' or its corresponding type declarations.
     8 |
     9 | export * from "./helpers";
  > 10 | export * from "./logger";
       |               ^
    11 |
    12 | export declare class Store<S> {
    13 |   constructor(options: StoreOptions<S>);
```

---
Fix: Add `"types/helpers.d.ts",` to `package.json` `files` config (https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/v3.5.0/package.json#L11-L16).

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""types/logger.d.ts" file is missing from npm package" (#1788)

Issues.Title: feat: include logger plugin to the core export
Issues.Body:
This PR add `logger` plugin to the core export to be able to support ESM build for the `logger` plugin. Issue was mentioned at https://github.com/vitejs/vite/issues/334.

This is for Vuex 3, so I'm keeping the individual bundle as is to avoid braking change. For Vuex 4, I'm planning to remove the logger bundle entirely.

Planning to follow up the PR with documentation update as well for the next release.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat: include logger plugin to the core export" (#1783)

Issues.Title: test: migrate e2e test to puppeteer from nightwatch
Issues.Body:
This PR migrates E2E test from Nightwatch to Puppeteer to:

- Resolve nightwatch failing on CI time to time.
- Align with Vue Next E2E test.

Puppeteer is executed as a part of Jest. Helper functions for Puppeteer are taken from Vue Next repo, but few additional functions are added as well.

It removes `nightwatch` related dependencies.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "test: migrate e2e test to puppeteer from nightwatch" (#1778)

Issues.Title: Fix: Document return value when item was not found
Issues.Body:
This PR

* [x] documents the return value of `find` when an item was not found

💁‍♂️ I'm new to `vuejs` and `vuex`, so I'm not sure if this makes sense - but I could not find any documentation on what would be returned when an item is not found. What do you think?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix: Document return value when item was not found" (#1779)

Issues.Title: 开发模式下内存上涨严重
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.4.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/black-dust-d5jor?file=/src/App.vue](https://codesandbox.io/s/black-dust-d5jor?file=/src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
### ***链接内有截图***
1. 开发环境
  * electron:7.3.0
  * vue:2.6.11
  * @vue/cli:4.3.1
  * vue-cli-plugin-electron-builder:1.4.4

2. 我有一个WebSocket服务, 会不停的向客户端发送数据, 接收到的数据存入store中
开发模式下, 此时内存直线飙升, 短时间内可达到一两个G, 内存快照中占用量最多的是字符串，这些字符串全部是整个状态树的JSON字符串。
生产模式下没有问题


### What is expected?
占用内存正常

### What is actually happening?
占用内存过高, 经常导致crash

---
只在开发模式下有此问题

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "开发模式下内存上涨严重" (#1777)

Issues.Title: Vuex hasModule
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.4.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/hasmodule-inconsistent-with-string-x58fh?file=/src/App.vue](https://codesandbox.io/s/hasmodule-inconsistent-with-string-x58fh?file=/src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
Check for the existence of a nested module with a string, vs an array path.

### What is expected?
I would expect checking with a string or an equivalent array to produce the same result.

### What is actually happening?
Checking `hasModule` with a string returns false, while checking it with an equivalent array returns true.

---
I suppose this could be intentional, but it seems like a bug.  If it's not intentional it seems like a simple fix:

Line 219 in `src/store.js ` currently is:

```if (typeof path === 'string') path = [path]```

It seems like simply changing that to the following will fix the problem:

```if (typeof path === 'string') path = path.split("/")```

Thoughts?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Vuex hasModule" (#1781)

Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
when i use vue-property-decorator & vue 2 & typescript, my this.$store always is `Store<any>`，I found a solution

### What does the proposed API look like?
eg:
``` 
this.$store.state.user => (property) user?: Pick<Schema.TUser, "ID" | "name" | "class" | "role">
```

Issues.Title: Reactivity trigger on store.registerModule
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.4.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/vuex-dynamic-module-re-render-kju2b](https://codesandbox.io/s/vuex-dynamic-module-re-render-kju2b)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Initialize store
2. Add/register a module "x"
3. Register module "y1" within module "x". Module "y1" should contain a property "z" in its state
4. Create a computed property "c" in the app, which returns an object containing property "z" from module "y1" state
5. Create a watcher "w" for the computed property "c" with a logging function
6. Register module "y2" within module "x"
7. Observe watcher "w" being triggered

Reproduction is best described by the code in the provided test-case

### What is expected?
There should be no triggered getter reactivity for the properties in the state of a vuex module after a sibling module has been registered

### What is actually happening?
Upon registering a vuex module, getters for properties in the state of already registered sibling vuex modules are being triggered

---
Computed properties in the app, which do complex computations with values coming from the vuex modules, are being unnecessarily reexecuted on vuex module registration, substantially slowing down a complex application

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Reactivity trigger on store.registerModule" (#1765)

Issues.Title: Calls to mutations and  actions don't get cancelled when a module is unregistered using `unregisterModule`
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.4.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/mutation-call-after-unregistermodule-v4n3z](https://codesandbox.io/s/mutation-call-after-unregistermodule-v4n3z)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Make sure the first page you see is the `Home` page.
2. Click on `Contact` button and immediately click on `Home`
3. Observe the Console.



### What is expected?
No errors. When the module is unregistered, any running action or mutation calls should also be cancelled.

### What is actually happening?
The action/mutation code keeps executing and user sees errors in the Console stating that the module does not exist.
`[vuex] unknown local mutation type: setContact, global type: contact/setContact`

---
There are 2 components: `Home.vue` and `Contact.vue`. `Contact.vue` calls an action in it's `mounted` callback. The action `changeContact` mimics the behaviour of an API call and commits a mutation after a delay of 1 second.

What I am trying to do is that when user navigates from one page to another, the modules of the first route should be unregistered. This can be done easily using the `unregisterModule` method. The problem is that any action or mutation calls executed before the unregistering are not removed and they throw errors in the browser Console.

In the above sandbox, when user switches from Contact to Home immediately, following things happen:
- `Contact.vue` loads and it's mounted callback is called.
- Inside the `mounted` callback, the `changeContact` action is called
- User goes back to Home. This calls `beforeDestroy` of `Contact.vue` that un-registers the `contact` module.
- The `changeContact` tries to call the `setContact` mutation, but, since the module does not exist, an error message is thrown in the Console `[vuex] unknown local mutation type: setContact, global type: contact/setContact`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Calls to mutations and  actions don't get cancelled when a module is unregistered using `unregisterModule`" (#1767)
